author: Alessia Horwich
title: All the rage
text:
Alessia’s colleagues decided never to ask her to make the tea again (Andrew Hasson) When I was six years old, we booked a family summer holiday to California. We turned up at the airport at the crack of dawn, only to be bumped off the flight. From there unfurled what my father referred to in his speech at my wedding as “the Heathrow incident”. Not wanting to swap the dazzling heights of San Francisco for a night in Hounslow, I lay face down on the ground, pounded my fists on the faux-marble floor and screamed my guts out.
Fast-forward 25 years and I’m shrieking just as loudly, all the while thwacking an inanimate object with a baseball bat, except this time nobody’s telling me off. In fact, I’m being actively encouraged. I’m at Ockenden Manor, a chic spa hotel in West Sussex, for the launch of a women-only Tantrum Club spa day, which includes a massage, a posh lunch and a glass of bubbly
